titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

div.p: 1. Thursday. V:30. Night Gale. Chimney top blown down— Books arrived from Boston— Hyde at the Office— Trial of la Jeune Eugenie— Consul’s protest not admitted— Form of interposition— Precedents— Balaou—Cranch’s Repts. 9.— Calhoun at the Office— Jackson’s Address— Menou overtook us—papers. Peters & Washington’s decrees. Martens 9. Suppr. 2. p. 442. Frye’s dined with us— Depn. Caldwell and J. Law.

2— VI: At P.U.S— Crawford there— Case of British vessel at St. Augustine. Stackelberg— Norwegian Treaty— [symbols] Hyde’s application and case of La Jeune Eugénie— Eve at Dr Thornton’s— Burton—d’Aspremont.

3. VI:30. [symbols][Cabinet Meeting] full— Case of O. Forward— Of La Jeune Eugénie—opinions as to the mode of proceeding— Case of the San José at Baltimore postponement. Merrick nephew of J. Vaughan at the Office— Cass and W. Lee here— Caldwell & Law—depositions.
4. V.45. Heard Little— Psalm 12.6.5. Death of his Son— All the rest of the day, writing— Heard of death of Mary Ann Stewart.

5. V:30— Caldwell & Law here—then at the Office again after taking Crawfords last Answer, at eve here— Went from me to Calhoun’s to close the Commission— Talk with Bailey— Canning at the Office— To see Calhoun for paper.— Boundary Commrs—disagree—

6. V:15 Dr Thornton here. His plan of institute Garden— Office— Menou for papers— At Calhoun’s—paper— W. Hardwick— T. B. A. jr— C’s advice not to let him enter under 15— Comm̃n. closed— Crawford’s recom̃n. of Flournoy— His confidences to Harris.— At Wirt’s with H. d. N’s papers. His arguments— Despatch to Rush—oppy for France— R. Barnwall—

7. V:15. At Wirt’s Office with Reports— Further question about La Jeune Eugénie— At P.U.S—to meet to-morrow— Draft to Gallatin— Cass— Barnwall. Lloyd dined with us— Barnwell, unwell— Rutgers at the Office.

8. V: Chimnies mended. [symbols][Cabinet Meeting] full— Case of La Jeune Eugénie. Wirt’s argumt. agt. surrender— P.U.S—his opn— Case in England 1806. Thompson’s objns. Crawford and Calhoun’s obsns—proof of France’s insincerity— The flag— Piracy. Revenue laws— Draft to Gallatin— His Note to Pasquier of 28 June, and Letter of 2 [symbols][July]. Carlton Island case— Letter to J. T— Govr. Clinton— Met Frye’s— Chess. A. Edwards
9. III:45. Chimney mending— Bailey— Gales’s self-defence. At P.U.S— Draft to G. Blake— J. M conditional pardon— Consulate, Buenos Ayres— J. Mason junr at the Office— Evening writing.

10. IV:45. Shaler at the Office— His Accts. 2d. Algerine Treaty— A. Edwards. Consulate Buenos-Ayres— Other applications— going to-morrow— Budget from W. G. D. Worthington— Papers— Military— Draft of minutes for Message on foreign Affairs— Frye dined with us.

11. IV:15. Heard Little. John 12.26. Character of Christ— Call with Watkins, and George upon Wyer: in bed—home. Mails— Visits to Coll. Gadsden, and Major Van de Venter— Captain Smith &c to Genl. Macomb. Cass & Captn. Root there— Walk home. Diary— Dr Thornton at Eve—

12. IV:30. Awake at III.15. too early. Draft from [symbols][P.U.S.] with amendmt. to G. Blake— Letter to G. C. Anduaga— Canning. mema. at P.U.S— Met Calhoun there— War Dept. estimates— St. Augustine Barracks— Jac. Eustis and Bell— Buenos-Ayres Consulate— Minutes for Message— Shaler here at Eve.

13. IV:15. Force here, for book binding— Com: Tingey with T. Willing.— At the Office. W. Shaler—his book— Accts. Postage 50. Judge Advocate 500. Consulate robbed 200 of 4— Stevenson— Pennsylvania Legislation— Statesman. B. O. Tyler. Franklin Insurance Company Stock— M’Cormick— Wyer. Of Com. Rogers— H. G. Otis—and King R. & W— Genl. Mason. W. North for Consul at Lima. At [symbols][P.U.S.] Clinton’s Letter— Carleton Island. Alternative force or breaking up of establishment. To call meeting. Consulates at Lima, Buenos Ayres, Angostura &c— Anduaga’s Letter. San Jose Baltimore. Rush’s despatch— Very good— Eve writing— George unwell—

14. VI:15. Awoke at 3. & then overslept. Calhoun here—asks for Bell’s papers. Doubts the powers of the City Council at St Augustine— Russell—model of the Capitol. Cass, going to-morrow— At the Office— Wyer— Letter to J. E. Hall— Cass here at Eve— And Canning. Mrs A. was bled— Mix at the Office.

15. IV:45. Cabinet Meeting— Crawford absent, unwell— Clinton’s Letter. Carleton Island— Ch— Smyth— Esselstyn— Smuggling— Various opinions. P.U.S. to write to Canning— Calhoun and Wirt to disclaim possession. Thompson to maintain it, and believe it unauthorized by Canadian Government— Mix’s case— Case of Jos. F. Smith— P.U.S. keeps Carleton Island papers to give directions— Newfoundland piracy papers to Wirt— Hyde at the Office— Read to him my Letter to G. Blake— Talk of other affairs— Proposal of Slave trade Comm̃rs— Asked if we had a copy of Gallatin’s note to Pasquier— Said he should go next Spring— Bailey here at Eve— Street door key lost. Pitt’s Life—done

16. V. Mrs. A. and George unwell. Travers at the Office for I. P. Hutchinson. Burton’s appointment at Oporto— W. Lee— Armstrong—gave him a copy of the Newburgh Letters— Wilkinson’s treachery— Colvin’s talk— Elliot and Irvine— Rapine— Young Hamilton’s passage through to the West. Note from Canning— Morning Note from Wirt.

17. IV:30. Mrs. Adams unwell—bled. Saw the Models of the Capitol, and Baltimore Exchange— Shaler at the Office; and Wyer. Call at Wirt’s with Canning. Delivery of culprits— Powers of P.U.S—of Congress—of State Governors—to see laws faithfully executed—Laws of Nations—Grotius—Vattel—Burlamaqui— Eveng party at Thornton’s— Mrs Lewis— Van Ness’s there— George went— Shaler here. beads.

18. V.45. Heard Little. Luke 11.42— Ceremonial rites— Visit to Anderson— His family indisposed— Visit fromJohnson of Louisiana— Mail. Dr. Thornton here at Eve— Mrs. Adams— George and Mary Hellen, unwell.

19. VI— My Note to order of B. O. Tyler, (endorsed by him to the Franklin Insurance Company) for $1040. for 52 Shares of Stock transferred to me by—Alr. M’Cormick. At the Office. J. L. Cathcart—with Letters from Messrs. Jefferson and Madison. His wants— Stackelberg— Apology for writing to Secy Treasy— At [symbols][P.U.S.] Wirt there. Carleton Island &c— Wirt remarks about Clinton. Calhoun came in— Draft to Worthington— The first sketch of the Message as to the foreign affairs prepared— List of Acts and Proclamations repealing discriminating duties— Draft to S. Canning abt. Carleton Island— Mrs. Adams yet keeps her chamber.

20. V. At the Office— W. Taylor— Consulate. Carthagena— Barber. Transactions of the Royal Society— At [symbols][P.U.S.] Draft of Message concerning foreign Relations—review of system— Adherence to it— Met Tayloe, going in— Going to morrow for S.C. very ill— Note from Anduaga— Spanish Officers banishment. Draft to R. W. Habersham— Hertslett to Wirt— Mrs Adams dined below—

21. V:15. Bailey here— Letter from I. Munroe— Dr Jedson’s Case— Little, and the Unitarian Church— At the Office. Wyer there— W. Taylor— His Com̃n for Carthagena— Despatches from R. Rush— Fromentin and W. C. Bradley. All the Office hours reading them.

22. IV.45— At the Office— W. Elliot’s Son— Blagrove’s Letter— J. Mason jr. for W. North as Consul to Lima— S. Thompson— King’s Letter to him—read him draft to Canning— Fiske’s Letter— Surgeon’s mate none— At [symbols][P.U.S.] with Draft to Clinton— Fromentin’s Letters—outrageous—doubts— Bradley’s difference of Comm̃rs— Hughes’s Letter—proposal to Gallatin—its rejection shall we negotiate instead of referring?— Message Swedish Treaty—arrangement of Message— Meeting at Noon, to-morrow, to settle whether taxes shall be proposed.

23. VI.15. [symbols] Question, shall internal taxes be recommended— Crawford’s; Calhoun’s calculations— Revenue of this year— Estimated revenue of the next 15 Millions from Customs— 5 per Ct. Addl. duty on Linens and Silks— King of France’s, exportations from N.Y. Natural Histy— Indians, intercourse with the British—to be cut-off class— Shaler’s Accts— Secy Navy’s allowances.

24. IV:45— Rain, Hail and Storm— At P.U.S— To receive Canning on Monday— Letter from Jas G. Forbes— Jennings and Parke— Ch. Dewey— Distt. Atty. Indiana— Fromentin’s Letters—communicated to Winder who thinks he will withdraw them— April arrears commenced.

25. IV:30. George unwell. Heard Little—Luke 4.23— Visit to Josiah Meigs. reading mail absorbed the day— Despatch from C. Hughes. Note from Engeström— Swedish Navigation Act— Note from Anduaga— Coppinger’s protest. Hyde at Eve— Menace of War— Mrs A at Dr. Thornton’s

26. V. Josiah Meigs, S. H. Smith and Mathews here. Library subscription— W. Taylor— At P.U.S. with Canning— Letter from King of G.B. Death of the Queen— Canning said I owed him 4. Notes—what?— Newfoundland Pirates— Cases of delivery from Canada— Seizures in Nova-Scotia— Has received the Carleton Island Letter— S. Thompson at P.U.S— Report on Convn. with Hyde— Message to be altered— Meeting for to-morrow at 11. G. Hay— Winder applies to withdraw Fromentin’s Letters— Not proper to give them up— W. Taylor and Vera-Cruz— At the Office—despatch from A. Middleton— Calhoun at the Office— Cross’s Letter about buildings at St. Augustine— Hyde’s threats—

27. VI.15. Overslept— Mrs A sick in the Night— G. S. Bourne here—for Office. Now with Taney at Frederick. [symbols] full.— Hyde’s menaces— How to be noticed. Whether all the papers to be communicated to Congress— At first agreed to— My proposal then to see H. de N—further discussion. Crawford averse to communicating the papers. Conversation of Hyde with him— Wirt’s ideas as to the Jurisdiction— Calhoun’s as to France’s right to complain— Message to state the difficulties—but papers not now to be communicated. Received Despatches from Gallatin 26. Septr. & RushOctr. Frye’s here at . . .

28. V: J. Rhea and Roberdeau here— P.U.S. at the Office. Despatches from Gallatin 5. Octr. and Middleton 11. Septr. PS—[symbols] full— P.U.S. read the paragraphs prepared for the Message. Remarks. Partiality for England— cypher Conjectures of the disposition of France— Their policy—to make quarrels. Observation—to turn the attack—my remarks to P.U.S— Freedom of Commerce. His promise— Assorted the Apollon papers— Mrs S. Clarke and Susan at dinner. Mrs Brodeau and Mrs Thornton at Eve— Parish at the Office— Bowie & Kurtz—award.

29— V: G. Hay here. J. W. Taylor— Prospect of Revenue— Tariff, Loans—Taxes—prospects of confidence— Met R. M. Johnson and his brother—John T. Johnson— At P.U.S. Wirt’s and Crawford’s Offices— Canning’s piracy papers— Cranch. D’Aspremont.

30. V:30— G. S. Bourne here— R. M. Johnson. Woodson, Smith and J. T. Johnson. Dickenson here— Speaker. At P.U.S— Indians— Talk abt. Armstrong— Cranch and Shaler to dinner— Preble and Stirling at the Office. Gorham & Warfield
